amount_of_each_solvent.DMF: 20 mL for washing, 45 mL for soaking
amount_of_each_solvent.acetone: 45 mL for washing, 45 mL for final rinse

synthesis.equipment: 20-mL screw neck glass vial, 50mL centrifuge vial
synthesis.temperature: 120 °C for synthesis, 50 °C for DMF soak, room temperature for activation
synthesis.time: 48 h for synthesis, 12 h for DMF soak, 12 h for acetone soak, 12 h under vacuum for activation
synthesis.washing_method: Washed five times with DMF and acetone
synthesis.drying_method: Under vacuum at room temperature followed by 120 °C under vacuum for 12 h

synthesis.washing_method: Washed with DMF (5 × 50 mL) over twelve hours, then soaked in DMF at 50 °C, followed by acetone wash (5 × 30 mL) over 24 hours

reactions.name: Tandem oxidation reaction of styrene with O2 using Fe@Hf-2

conditions.temperature: 80 °C for drying reactor, reaction conducted at room temperature
conditions.post_reaction_treatment: Cooled in ice bath, vented, opened, and catalyst separated by centrifugation

reactions.safety_notes: Azidotrimethylsilane (TMS-N3) is incompatible with moisture, oxidizing agents, and acids. It is easily decomposed to other compounds, e.g., hydrolyzed to hydrazoic acid (hydrogen azide) which is an extremely toxic and explosive material. Therefore, the safety regulations for this reaction must be strictly followed.
